bibl.title: Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Suguiro v. State of Washington. Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: In the United States District Court in and for the Western District Of Washington, Northern Division.
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaduro Sugiuro aliad B.K. Sugiuro for a writ of habeas corpus. } No. 2504 Writ of Habeas Corpus.
The United States of America to Joseph R.H. Joacoby, Marshall in and for the Court and District aforesaid, greetings:

You are hereby commanded and directed to have the bodies of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Suguiro illegally imprisoned and detained by you, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention before the Honorable E.E. Cushman, Judge of the Districrt Court of the United States in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division thereof, in the court room of said court at the city of Seattle within said district on the 23rd day of June, 1913 at 2 o'clock in the afternoon of said day, then and there to do and receive what it shall then and there be considred and decreed concerning the said Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro.

Witness the Honorable E.E. Cushman, Judge of the above entitled court at the court room thereof in the city of Seattle within said district on the 19th day of June, 1913.
Edward E. Cushman Judge
Attest my hand and thee seal of the said court the day and your last above writes. Frank L. Crosby
By Deputy Clerk.
